content.description: The only sport route on the crag. Well protected, sweet slab climbing with multiple cruxes. Trusting your feet is essential to sucess on this route.
content.location: The fourth route encountered as you approach from the south. Ten feet right of "Big Ones".

content.description: The easy way to the summit. Climb the tiered slabs following the obvious weaknesses to the summit.
content.location: North end of the formation. Wander up the tiered slabs.

content.description: This route works up past a bolt or two then over the overlap and up into a finger crack. Fun moves with thought provoking protection,
content.protection: Bolts, One set of stoppers, One set of cams .4" to 2", Slings   Make every placement count on this pitch   Bolted chain anchor
content.location: The fifth route on the wall as you approach fro the south. Starts just left of the tree which is about 20' right of "Recycled Love".

content.description: This sexy looking finger crack is capped off with a tricky lower angle slab. Solid fingers and hand jams up a near to vertical wall. Super stellar for the grade. One of kind route for the Rushmore area.
content.protection: One set of stopper, one set of cams .4" to 3", slings & quick draws.   Bolted chain anchors
content.location: The second route you encounter on the approach. Follows a slightly leftward arcing finger crack that terminated about 70' up. Located about 20' right of "Love Above".

content.description: Leftmost route with a bolt protected slab leading to a hand crack. Multiple cruxes of several varieties. Great route overall with very thought provoking moves.
content.protection: One set of cams .4" to 3.5", set of stoppers, slings & quick draws.   There are minimal placements in the last 25' feet of the route providing for some runout 5.8 climbing.   Bolted chain anchors.
content.location: The route is the left most route located near the south end of the east face. This is the first route you will encounter on the approach.

content.description: Super stellar moderate with great protection. Fingers to hand jams up a right facing corner. Do it!!!
content.protection: One set of stoppers, One set of cams .5" to 4", Slings   Bolted chain anchors (possible to reach ground with a 60M rope from the first set of anchors).
content.location: The sixth route which is near the north end of the east face. The route climbs a right facing dihedral. Start on a slab crossing a diagonal quartz vein to reach the dihedral.

content.description: The route follows the only continuous crack up a right facing dihedral. Neat moves of many size jams from tips to fists. Some stemming and liebacking. Scary moves protected by mariginal gear on the upper incipient runout cracks.
content.protection: One set of stoppers, One set of cams .4" to 4", slings   Bolted chain anchors
content.location: The third route encountered as you approach from the south. Splitter wide appearing crack that runs bottom to top. Enters a right facing dihedral about 40' up.

content.description: A beautiful dome in a beautiful location. East/Southeast facing slab & crack climbing in a secluded valley hidden in a spruce forest. Some of the best splitter cracks in the Black Hills. The routes are right at 100' in length. Morning to early afternoon sun and sheltered from the wind. A good place on a warm winter day. Afternoon shade for summer outings.
